I am so thankful!

Thank you @Michael Keating for todays office hours talk. I really appreciate everything you've said to me today, all your questions, advices that you've given me. All of them will help me clarify more what I want and what I will do in a near future. Also thanks to @Amarnath Jayanti @sidcode @snax y-not for listening to my story and giving me your advice. I really needed to hear that. And thanks @Vivek Singh for connecting me with Michael. Kernel is such a great community :kernel-love:

I see there's many emotions building in each one of us being expressed in various ways, beautiful to see it all and the journey that we embarked together. If this is just the starting, can't imagine the beauty of the game ahead!

U021LLE92KY.message:
Thank you from the KERNEL community to our courageous steward of care, @Vivek Singh. 

Yesterday Vivek led a conversation at the ETHDenver event <https://schellingpoint.gitcoin.co/|Schelling Point> on *Communities of Care*. The presentation was a beautiful representation of our community. Thank you for leadership, for acknowledging members of the community and sharing universal knowledge. 

I am grateful that I was able to support you IRL with Kernel friends @johnx25bd, @Paul Gadi and @Muhammad Hameed. 

Vivek wore a beautiful scarf (see the picture to confirm consensus). @cryptowanderer’s spirit was felt :kernel-love: 

Shoutout to Kernel Fellows at the event: @Aliya, @Abe Uccello and @Kyle Smith (sorry for anyone I missed :pray::skin-tone-6:)

Hugh thanks of  @Kyle Smith  , for organising ~junto~ 1:1 talk  on discussing  the consequential movement  "right of repair" and understanding diffrent aspects , and at the end discussing the ideas  for creating an guild of DIY engineers for onboarding the web3 ecosystem on embedded SoC's ( like rasp 0 , DIY projects  ) so that future generations will be accustomed  as true #BUILDL'ers ( having  significant sovereignty from  hardware to software stack) :building_construction: :hammer_and_pick: :male-construction-worker: :female-construction-worker: .

Thank you so very, very much to @Kyle Smith @Michael Newman @Ben B @Dhruv Malik @Marcel Jackisch for reviewing different aspects of the Learning Curve contracts, and to @Carter Carlson for finding at least some time to kick start that process with the best practicers :pray:

We will benefit greatly from your kind attention and care :kernel-love:
grateful to @Paul Gadi @Kyle Smith from KB3 and everyone else who joined <https://ethturin.eth.link> over the weekend! we made it.

@Songyi Lee can help :slightly_smiling_face:

There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

@Andros Wong & @Songyi Lee thank you both for your time and patience, as is the nature of reciprocity I feel indebted to you both if ever there's anything I can do, well lets keep in touch :rainbowheart:

@Songyi Lee @Tim Courtney @snax y-not all for points on curation vs. volume discussion and thoughts on DAOs modeled as libraries / supportive of different personal hobbies. Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> and all the people I met along the way for this amazing journey.

:sunny: I started KERNEL very hopeful, thinking I had found likeminded people, a community to learn, to build, and to be myself and not have to explain context before saying something.

:partly_sunny_rain: Then I realized how wrong I was! I would be asking myself "WTF are they talking about?" during fireside chats or random juntos; I'd get frustrated with how (maybe intentionally) unclear KERNEL is (you have to create your own adventure, of which KERNEL is a tool... I guess); I'd get a little jealous seeing all the people saying thank you on this channel, feeling "should I be doing more to get as enthusiastic and happy as them?"; and just generally anxious for not having enough time to be with my family, do my full-time job (not for long), work on the next adventure, and also read and watch all the curated material.

I'm not gonna lie, I still have those negative (complementary opposing) feelings... at least sometimes :slightly_smiling_face:.

:mostly_sunny:But then I realized people and groups don't (necessarily) care about my expectations. I really understood and appreciated the "group with loosely shared interests" description of the fellows. I started to find new language to express my ideas, to communicate better, and to just appreciate those conflicting feelings, because they moved me to action. I found myself having more conversations and asking better questions (initially just to myself). And finally, thanks to a conversation with @Sarah Hamburg, who wisely said "KERNEL is a marathon, not a sprint" (Thanks for that, Sarah!), I started to think more long-term.

:kernel-love: Thank you for igniting this in me. From this inner turmoil, love-hate relationship, that KERNEL has been, a new (hopefully better) Guillermo emerges.
I look forward to more adventures together and continue to obsessively check this slack in the future (I struggle to control my FOMO). Thanks @Sarah Hamburg @Holly Grimm @Saskia Westhof @Aimara Garcia Cabezas @Greg Becker @Ray Di Felice @snax y-not @Tim Courtney for amazing conversations.

Finally, the whole theme of KERNEL reminded me of <https://sites.evergreen.edu/politicalshakespeares/wp-content/uploads/sites/226/2015/12/Borges-Tl%C3%B6n-Uqbar-Orbius-Tertius.pdf|"Tlon, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius">, by my favorite author Jorge Luis Borges. Check it out.
> "Then English and French and mere Spanish will disappear from the globe. The world will be Tlon."

Today, I wish to offer my sincerest gratitude to @kei for all the work she has done over many years which continually inspires, guides and delights me. Being thus, I have <https://kernel.community/en/learn/module-4/self-enquiry|replaced the old identity piece in Module 4> with another essay mixer based largely on her idea of Inventories, coupled with an essay from Aaron Lewis and a few other hidden gems.

One such hidden gem comes from @Jasmine Wang and is all about <https://kernel-community.slack.com/archives/C01857MHZGT/p1638858113179500|attention>. I heartily suggest you give it some of yours.

Another thread links to @Anna Alexa and @Kelsey Chen, both of whom were kind enough to recommend Braiding Sweetgrass to me, which has <https://kernel.community/en/conversation/reciprocity/|found its way into the syllabus> along with this new piece on inventive interfaces for those who want to trace the reciprocal web of relationships right down into the roots :pray:

You are all incredible and I have so much love for each of you.

There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

I couldn’t let this experience end without sending some love to the KB4 community. Kernel has been an amazing journey and I think the best part is that it feels like the start of an even richer adventure. I’ve had some incredible conversations over the past 8 weeks, but wanted to say a special thanks to a few people:
• @Jasmine Wang for an intellectual brunch that opened up a number of new paths for me :sailboat: 
• @Michael Zargham for helping me sift through the noise and zero in on where I want to focus :dart: 
• @cryptowanderer for (per usual) providing a level-headed perspective on this world :male_mage: 
• @snax y-not for riffing on food, fun, and the future of franchises :pizza: 
• @Michael Keating for comparing notes in the early days and spearheading the tokenomics guild :scales: 
• my ~girlfriend~ fiance for providing endless support and agreeing to marry me back in week 3 :ring: 
I’m gutted to miss the final session today (will be traveling :disappointed:), but I take solace in the fact that I’ll see you all out in the garden very soon :slightly_smiling_face:

Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> and all the people I met along the way for this amazing journey.

:sunny: I started KERNEL very hopeful, thinking I had found likeminded people, a community to learn, to build, and to be myself and not have to explain context before saying something.

:partly_sunny_rain: Then I realized how wrong I was! I would be asking myself "WTF are they talking about?" during fireside chats or random juntos; I'd get frustrated with how (maybe intentionally) unclear KERNEL is (you have to create your own adventure, of which KERNEL is a tool... I guess); I'd get a little jealous seeing all the people saying thank you on this channel, feeling "should I be doing more to get as enthusiastic and happy as them?"; and just generally anxious for not having enough time to be with my family, do my full-time job (not for long), work on the next adventure, and also read and watch all the curated material.

I'm not gonna lie, I still have those negative (complementary opposing) feelings... at least sometimes :slightly_smiling_face:.

:mostly_sunny:But then I realized people and groups don't (necessarily) care about my expectations. I really understood and appreciated the "group with loosely shared interests" description of the fellows. I started to find new language to express my ideas, to communicate better, and to just appreciate those conflicting feelings, because they moved me to action. I found myself having more conversations and asking better questions (initially just to myself). And finally, thanks to a conversation with @Sarah Hamburg, who wisely said "KERNEL is a marathon, not a sprint" (Thanks for that, Sarah!), I started to think more long-term.

:kernel-love: Thank you for igniting this in me. From this inner turmoil, love-hate relationship, that KERNEL has been, a new (hopefully better) Guillermo emerges.
I look forward to more adventures together and continue to obsessively check this slack in the future (I struggle to control my FOMO). Thanks @Sarah Hamburg @Holly Grimm @Saskia Westhof @Aimara Garcia Cabezas @Greg Becker @Ray Di Felice @snax y-not @Tim Courtney for amazing conversations.

Finally, the whole theme of KERNEL reminded me of <https://sites.evergreen.edu/politicalshakespeares/wp-content/uploads/sites/226/2015/12/Borges-Tl%C3%B6n-Uqbar-Orbius-Tertius.pdf|"Tlon, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius">, by my favorite author Jorge Luis Borges. Check it out.
> "Then English and French and mere Spanish will disappear from the globe. The world will be Tlon."

I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:
Thank you for organizing such a great convo junto today @Vienna Looi. Loved learning with you and @Holly Grimm. You all have such beautiful minds
Thank you @Vienna Looi for making me remember how great the practice of martial arts feels. My body, mind, and soul are grateful for our last night junto. Great talk. Thank you:pray: :rainbowheart:

I see there's many emotions building in each one of us being expressed in various ways, beautiful to see it all and the journey that we embarked together. If this is just the starting, can't imagine the beauty of the game ahead!

@Renee Maria Lee @Vienna Looi @Sachin Mittal @Vivek Singh @Michael Keating @Martin Etzrodt @O'Plerou Grebet @Ben Percifield @Erin Pangilinan @sidcode @alisha @Tommy Nienchi Chen @Sister Tibebwa @Ai Tuonoin @Amarnath Jayanti @Bella Dokell @johnx25bd & many more I've met on this journey and yet to meet :pray: deep gratitude and  :heart: love for sharing the space you all did!

I love that you have words for all of this @Vienna Looi  you are so making the difference, right now. Thank you for sharing you wisdom, passion and good reads, still working through the Dawn of Everything and have added Meisers "Justice is an option" to the list.:heart: :exploding_head: :fire:
Thank you for the meditation (cooking @Vienna Looi . Great spending time with you @sidcode @Tian Zhao @Saskia Westhof
Also shout-out to @Vienna Looi who I absolutely also adore :wink:

I so appreciated the conversations in Kernel Office hours with @Vivek Singh @Vienna Looi @Anuj Kodam earlier today. Right afterward and some cooking, I cancelled an event I was going to work on with a finance association I had some issues with (a lot of them in traditional banking that sort of erked me) for my non-profit, and I felt like I was just a hamster on a wheel, rather than chilling, cooling down, and coming from a very intentional place. Ultimately Kernel overall has challenged me a lot to think highly about quality, to be a better more soulful version of myself. I also appreciate the fact that there is so much attention paid to with artists, poetry, and things that make me feel human again, many things that I have felt are never shared in other spaces I traversed from the get-go the last 7 years (AR VR AI in particular), and being human-centric in mind in that regard. I feel very nourished and rejuvenated. While I have a lot on my plate, I also want to +1 what Vivek said about ‘double majoring and minoring’ while I try to get a way with showcasing I wish 3 ventures next week at Expo, I’ll really limit it to 1-2 so I can showcase quality to the rest of the Kernel community. Thank you for our amazing conversation today, I learned so much through osmosis being in the space with you all!

I would like to express my gratitude to @Carmen, @alisha, @Ciaran Moore and @Rachel H for an amazing junto session last friday ! The ideas that resounded around the space were truly inspiring and really helped me in the direction of understanding what social movement could be within web3 .
I am working on a document with the ideas discussed what I will share here , and following one of the questions proposed (Who should we bring to blockchain that isn't here yet ?) , I have invited Marc Streit to join us for a talk . Marc is a swiss dance curator that has been a driving force for Zurichs queer alternative and underground performance scene, having curated Zurich Moves for the last 7 years ! This is part of the idea of my Junto, to bring speakers from different artistic and production contexts and understand from the experienced voice what is at fault in the systems we have available right now, so that we can better them, if not totally changing them :heart:
and some food for thought on this sunday :heart: <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Body_without_organs>

Just had one and a half hour long wonderful chat with @alisha about all things KERNEL, Web3 and beyond. Such a great conversation! Very grateful for KERNEL to making this connection possible! :kernel-love:

Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> and all the people I met along the way for this amazing journey.

:sunny: I started KERNEL very hopeful, thinking I had found likeminded people, a community to learn, to build, and to be myself and not have to explain context before saying something.

:partly_sunny_rain: Then I realized how wrong I was! I would be asking myself "WTF are they talking about?" during fireside chats or random juntos; I'd get frustrated with how (maybe intentionally) unclear KERNEL is (you have to create your own adventure, of which KERNEL is a tool... I guess); I'd get a little jealous seeing all the people saying thank you on this channel, feeling "should I be doing more to get as enthusiastic and happy as them?"; and just generally anxious for not having enough time to be with my family, do my full-time job (not for long), work on the next adventure, and also read and watch all the curated material.

I'm not gonna lie, I still have those negative (complementary opposing) feelings... at least sometimes :slightly_smiling_face:.

:mostly_sunny:But then I realized people and groups don't (necessarily) care about my expectations. I really understood and appreciated the "group with loosely shared interests" description of the fellows. I started to find new language to express my ideas, to communicate better, and to just appreciate those conflicting feelings, because they moved me to action. I found myself having more conversations and asking better questions (initially just to myself). And finally, thanks to a conversation with @Sarah Hamburg, who wisely said "KERNEL is a marathon, not a sprint" (Thanks for that, Sarah!), I started to think more long-term.

:kernel-love: Thank you for igniting this in me. From this inner turmoil, love-hate relationship, that KERNEL has been, a new (hopefully better) Guillermo emerges.
I look forward to more adventures together and continue to obsessively check this slack in the future (I struggle to control my FOMO). Thanks @Sarah Hamburg @Holly Grimm @Saskia Westhof @Aimara Garcia Cabezas @Greg Becker @Ray Di Felice @snax y-not @Tim Courtney for amazing conversations.

Finally, the whole theme of KERNEL reminded me of <https://sites.evergreen.edu/politicalshakespeares/wp-content/uploads/sites/226/2015/12/Borges-Tl%C3%B6n-Uqbar-Orbius-Tertius.pdf|"Tlon, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius">, by my favorite author Jorge Luis Borges. Check it out.
> "Then English and French and mere Spanish will disappear from the globe. The world will be Tlon."
i love this @Aimara Garcia Cabezas!!!! Beautiful!!!!

Before starting KERNEL, I knew I wanted to build a dApp but had no idea what to build, how to build and who to build it with. Now at the end of KERNEL, not only I learnt so much about Web3, I went on an adventure with a wonderful team and made a beautiful prototype and working on a potentially world-changing idea. Thank you @Nate Jacobs and @Martin Etzrodt  and @Eddy Schauman-Haigh @Bolo Michelin @Amir Jabarivasal , also many others who have supported us along the way, particularly  @Brent Annells  and @Anuj Kodam for your generous connection and advice, and the wonderfully eloquent , generous and wise @cryptowanderer.  Now KB4 is ending but my web3 journey has just started. Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> for bringing in such wonderful people and creating this high trust space for magic to happen. :pray::kernel-love::shamrock::rainbow::heart::pray:

Thank you @Brent Annells for being so genuine and for offering your skills/talent in for framing ideas and putting them into clear messages. Thanks for taking your time and interest in learning about Nimbly and helping out! :raised_hands: Eternally grateful :pray:
Big gratitude to @Brent Annells for sharing some amazing idea synthesizing skills. Seriously good stuff!

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

I couldn’t let this experience end without sending some love to the KB4 community. Kernel has been an amazing journey and I think the best part is that it feels like the start of an even richer adventure. I’ve had some incredible conversations over the past 8 weeks, but wanted to say a special thanks to a few people:
• @Jasmine Wang for an intellectual brunch that opened up a number of new paths for me :sailboat: 
• @Michael Zargham for helping me sift through the noise and zero in on where I want to focus :dart: 
• @cryptowanderer for (per usual) providing a level-headed perspective on this world :male_mage: 
• @snax y-not for riffing on food, fun, and the future of franchises :pizza: 
• @Michael Keating for comparing notes in the early days and spearheading the tokenomics guild :scales: 
• my ~girlfriend~ fiance for providing endless support and agreeing to marry me back in week 3 :ring: 
I’m gutted to miss the final session today (will be traveling :disappointed:), but I take solace in the fact that I’ll see you all out in the garden very soon :slightly_smiling_face:

Thank you @Michael Keating for todays office hours talk. I really appreciate everything you've said to me today, all your questions, advices that you've given me. All of them will help me clarify more what I want and what I will do in a near future. Also thanks to @Amarnath Jayanti @sidcode @snax y-not for listening to my story and giving me your advice. I really needed to hear that. And thanks @Vivek Singh for connecting me with Michael. Kernel is such a great community :kernel-love:

A huge thank you to @Richard Blythman for the work he is doing on Algovera, which has been running as a recurring Kernel junto and is now its own guild (much like @Michael Keating's wonderful work with the tokenaughts): <https://kernel.community/en/build/decentralized-ai/>

If you're into either decentralizing AI, or tokenomics, or both - make sure to check out all the new resources on our build pages thanks to these wonderful people :kernel-love:

I see there's many emotions building in each one of us being expressed in various ways, beautiful to see it all and the journey that we embarked together. If this is just the starting, can't imagine the beauty of the game ahead!

@Renee Maria Lee @Vienna Looi @Sachin Mittal @Vivek Singh @Michael Keating @Martin Etzrodt @O'Plerou Grebet @Ben Percifield @Erin Pangilinan @sidcode @alisha @Tommy Nienchi Chen @Sister Tibebwa @Ai Tuonoin @Amarnath Jayanti @Bella Dokell @johnx25bd & many more I've met on this journey and yet to meet :pray: deep gratitude and  :heart: love for sharing the space you all did!

Here's my love letter to the space we call Kernel, Here's a little love letter to the space we call Kernel. @cryptowanderer I managed to mint it, gas was ok. :smiley:

<https://mirror.xyz/0x7BfE90590179A586080682f149d106b70cb51E3E/NOenCnVzH-Wx8eYMf81z0HYKlED-9HeXSzMGwWzENxs>

Pausing to compile notes from calls with amazing Kernel folks this last week and reflect. So grateful to be in the company of such amazing, thoughtful people. Looking forward to the home stretch and working with y’all ongoing. Thx @Michael Keating @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh @Divine Artis @En Canada and also thanks to everyone who has responded thoughtfully to my questions and prompts this week :slightly_smiling_face: :kernel-love:
Thank you to @alisha @Michael Keating @Artem B. and @Michelle Ma for a great discussion on tokens in our junto breakout room yesterday!
Thank you very much to @Michael Keating for being the spark that ignited the Arweave wildfire talk, and for so gracefully surrendering your junto to two tokenomic nerds :kernel-love:

Grateful to be alive today!

Also big thanks to @Michael Keating @Ben Percifield for taking time out to talk strategy and branding for <http://wall.app|wall.app>
Excited to share with you all what we've been building :bouncingparrot:

Opsie I totally grabbed one before seeing these were maybe for a future cohort. Score though! low gas fees almost down a third since trying to delegate votes the other day... For some reason, it did not verify my Twitter account, ces't la vie So stoked to have met you @Anuj Kodam and been afforded your company in the sharing of our stories. :yellow_heart:

I'm reading this and bouncing around playing a song that @sidcode sent me for my love of temperature <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dW2MmuA1nI4> (I'm dancing right into <https://showgirlawakening.com/> sesh now <helped me, they're in the bay @Erin Pangilinan)

Thank you for this game of life @Erin Pangilinan @Vivek Singh @Anuj Kodam :cherry_blossom:

Thank you to @Vivek Singh @Ben Lakoff @Praneeth Srikanti @Carra Wu for the pep talks, I needed it badly, hope I didn’t take up too much space! Kudos @Sister Tibebwa - who is so inspiring and grounding me and giving me so much insight on how I can structure a DAO in the Filipinx American community (related to my non-profit eventually)  and tie it back to environmental justice, fighting climate change in the Philippines. Super impressed with everyone I saw at Expo, from @Andros Wong @CJ Hetherington @Richard Blythman @Hithesh Shaji @Kevin Seagraves @Filipe Macedo @Andreas Vilela @Pedro Oliveira @Anuj Kodam @Amarnath Jayanti @gwendall. You all raise the bar so high and it is making me want to do so much more grounded in good principles. I’m excited for @Bianca Aguilar @Vince Trost @Andrew C @Elmo Chong - can’t wait to see what you all do in your next iteration!

So much gratitude for the opportunity to share a story in last weeks kernel junto. I cried, again. It's an amazing empowering feeling to have a context within which to tell some small but deeply meaningful part of my lifestory without feeling openly critisied or judged. @Tommy Nienchi Chen for an opening to share my 'freedom of choice' within a direct context:seedling: @Anuj Kodam your support meant the world to me thank you, thank you for seeing courage where so many others would see failure/stubborness/stupidity :heart: @cryptowanderer for sharing your story which in stark contrast to my freedom, helps as always build perspective :peace_symbol: And ghandi's note "my life is my message" - I can highly recommend the autobiography (read after the fact):book: And to my fourth quiet listener, sorry I forget :wave: you guys have no idea how transformative it is to share some truths outside of my family and friends. Love light & blessing to you each XXOO

I so appreciated the conversations in Kernel Office hours with @Vivek Singh @Vienna Looi @Anuj Kodam earlier today. Right afterward and some cooking, I cancelled an event I was going to work on with a finance association I had some issues with (a lot of them in traditional banking that sort of erked me) for my non-profit, and I felt like I was just a hamster on a wheel, rather than chilling, cooling down, and coming from a very intentional place. Ultimately Kernel overall has challenged me a lot to think highly about quality, to be a better more soulful version of myself. I also appreciate the fact that there is so much attention paid to with artists, poetry, and things that make me feel human again, many things that I have felt are never shared in other spaces I traversed from the get-go the last 7 years (AR VR AI in particular), and being human-centric in mind in that regard. I feel very nourished and rejuvenated. While I have a lot on my plate, I also want to +1 what Vivek said about ‘double majoring and minoring’ while I try to get a way with showcasing I wish 3 ventures next week at Expo, I’ll really limit it to 1-2 so I can showcase quality to the rest of the Kernel community. Thank you for our amazing conversation today, I learned so much through osmosis being in the space with you all!

I'm reading this and bouncing around playing a song that @sidcode sent me for my love of temperature <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dW2MmuA1nI4> (I'm dancing right into <https://showgirlawakening.com/> sesh now <helped me, they're in the bay @Erin Pangilinan)

Thank you for this game of life @Erin Pangilinan @Vivek Singh @Anuj Kodam :cherry_blossom:

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

Thank you to @Vivek Singh @Ben Lakoff @Praneeth Srikanti @Carra Wu for the pep talks, I needed it badly, hope I didn’t take up too much space! Kudos @Sister Tibebwa - who is so inspiring and grounding me and giving me so much insight on how I can structure a DAO in the Filipinx American community (related to my non-profit eventually)  and tie it back to environmental justice, fighting climate change in the Philippines. Super impressed with everyone I saw at Expo, from @Andros Wong @CJ Hetherington @Richard Blythman @Hithesh Shaji @Kevin Seagraves @Filipe Macedo @Andreas Vilela @Pedro Oliveira @Anuj Kodam @Amarnath Jayanti @gwendall. You all raise the bar so high and it is making me want to do so much more grounded in good principles. I’m excited for @Bianca Aguilar @Vince Trost @Andrew C @Elmo Chong - can’t wait to see what you all do in your next iteration!

@Andros Wong & @Songyi Lee thank you both for your time and patience, as is the nature of reciprocity I feel indebted to you both if ever there's anything I can do, well lets keep in touch :rainbowheart:

Awesome to catch up with @Andros Wong - a reconnect from another context. He’s working on a cool project around tokenomics and productivity tooling - if you’re into that stuff I’d definitely recommend hitting him up. I left thinking about Jira tokens and I’m not sure whether to cry or feel joy :joy:

There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.
Thank you to @alisha @Michael Keating @Artem B. and @Michelle Ma for a great discussion on tokens in our junto breakout room yesterday!

U02F9DF1Z6J.message: PS I was also super duper excited to see folks I've known for years be apart of this space from day 1 I jumped. #1) My favorite acoustic guitarist I knew from my early college days at UCSC (before transferring to Cal/UC Berkeley), the best person I could find that can sing both Usher “Yeah” and Britney Spears “Toxic” tracks, this universally beautiful and talented artist in so many mediums, @Lani Trock. And #2) one of my fav dev friends, fellow metaverse/spatial computing/XR homie and contributing author to my book, Creating AR VR @Dilan Shah who I've seen grow so much (before YUR, seeing its evolution, and now watching from afar his new take with web3). They have the best data viz hands down and Dilan is a pioneer in this space so I just wanted to shout him out and given him some love.

U02FD5U9V2R.message: There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

:heart: Very thankful to @Juanna Zhai @Mitzy C @Chase Chapman for bringing up Kernel and encouraging joining Kernel :smiling_face_with_3_hearts: And honestly just for this whole community. Much love to y'all

Feeling blessed to be here and thankful to @Mitzy C & @Juanna Zhai for sharing their stoke! so I could find my way here. Also yay for spring gardening, blossoming fruit trees, my beloved family, spring skiing & daylight savings +13 GMT

:heart: Very thankful to @Juanna Zhai @Mitzy C @Chase Chapman for bringing up Kernel and encouraging joining Kernel :smiling_face_with_3_hearts: And honestly just for this whole community. Much love to y'all

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

Grateful for @Daniel Thompson-Yvetot @Matthew Scott Jones for the fellowship and the connection. I am so thankful for the community as whole. This whole experience has been so great, I came in looking for one thing and I have received so much more value than I could have ever expected.
so nice to meet @Matthew Scott Jones! Totally forgot to snap a photo, but we had a great conversation over food today around my hood.
Thank you to @Matthew Scott Jones for organising <#C0181FL6N20|geo-london> dinner last night, for all who came for their great company and to Kernel for dinner :heart: :kernel-love: :pray:

U01JS6M1V9P.message: There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

I thought I'd drop a line here as I'm just jumping back into Kernel after quite a time away.  My web3 journey didn't start with Kernel but it did start with Gitcoin back in early 2019 after I heard a podcast with @Kevin Owocki that was my first step down the rabbit hole.  After hacking away on bounties for more than year (quite a few for Gitcoin Core), I saw the first mentions of the Kernel program and applied.  After a fruitful interview with @Vivek Singh and @Sachin Mittal, I waited a few weeks and wondered if I'd ever hear back.  I feel like the poster child for imposter syndrome in the web3 world and I was more than surprised when I got the email inviting me to join the Kernel Genesis Block.  The rest, as they say, is history.  I'm thankful for having been included in this community of builders and thinkers and also for the whole Gitcoin community of growing open source .  I'm definitely not the deepest thinker here or the best coder (not by a country mile), but it was this community that really helped me find my footing to go from where I was (someone who felt purposeless and unfruitful in my then vocation) to where I am now (an active, engaged dev working on Ethereum infrastructure who wakes up every day excited to do what I've been called to do and to see the world get turned upside down by what we're building).  So thank you @Kevin Owocki for building Gitcoin, @Vivek Singh, @Sachin Mittal,  and@cryptowanderer for Kernel, and to others along the way who have given me opportunities to build cool stuff and to be a part of web3 like @Rob Secord and @Ben Lakoff from Charged Particles, @Mike Elias from Idea Market, various folks from the Status/Nimbus team, @Shresth Agrawal, @Jose Aguinaga...etc.

Thankful to every single one of you. Happy to have found my soul family. Until now I felt out of place in life.

Thank you @Vivek Singh  for inviting me to kernel on that ocean presentation day. And thank you for constantly uplifting me exactly when I need it the most. Thank you for writing to Alex

Thank you @Sachin Mittal for your convos with me and for your support and trust

Thank you @cryptowanderer for being the most special and unique soul I’ve ever met :heart:

Thank you @Alex Masmej  for being so extraordinary and finding the time to meet. I want more ;)))

Thank you @Octavian Todirut for the sick Kernel swag design

Thank you @Kevin Owocki  for GitCoin. I’d be stuck in miserable finance world without you

Thank you @Simona Pop for helping me with the designs organisation

Thank you @Veronica Coutts for your help with my bonding curve. Please DM me I’ll send you some NAZ :)

Thank you Wildcards team, and especially Jason for the tip about front running resistance

Thank you @Manank Patni  for your sweet Figma design

Thank you @wschwab for great convos and being the first one to clap to my primitives ;)

Thank you EVERYONE. I deeply love and appreciate you all. If at any point I can be of any service to you. Summon me ;) twitter: @AlgorithmicBot. Telegram: nazariyv

And most importantly, thank you The V (Vitalik Buterin, right?), without you, none of us would be here. You should be a role model for everyone. If I can be of any service to you at all, I’d be overwhelmed with joy to help. Lots of love everyone. You will all succeed and make this world much much better!

Thanks to the Kernel Team, Mentors and awesome fellows. All of you have helped us shape some of the major decisions about our project and the way to take it forward :rocket:. I am grateful to all of you and see the relationships I build here to last forever. Deep gratitude and thanks to all of you, proud to have connected with (and learned from) @Vivek Singh @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal @Andrew Redden @Luka @Simona Pop @Thomas Klocanas @Linda Xie @Amy of BFLO @Tony Sheng @Angela Gilhotra @Denham -Wildcards/Float.Capital @Tarun Gupta @Anubhav Girdhar @Jo-Ann A. U02FNCH2F9A.message:
Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

Pausing to compile notes from calls with amazing Kernel folks this last week and reflect. So grateful to be in the company of such amazing, thoughtful people. Looking forward to the home stretch and working with y’all ongoing. Thx @Michael Keating @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh @Divine Artis @En Canada and also thanks to everyone who has responded thoughtfully to my questions and prompts this week :slightly_smiling_face: :kernel-love:

U021QBMDU21.message:
Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> and all the people I met along the way for this amazing journey.

:sunny: I started KERNEL very hopeful, thinking I had found likeminded people, a community to learn, to build, and to be myself and not have to explain context before saying something.

:partly_sunny_rain: Then I realized how wrong I was! I would be asking myself "WTF are they talking about?" during fireside chats or random juntos; I'd get frustrated with how (maybe intentionally) unclear KERNEL is (you have to create your own adventure, of which KERNEL is a tool... I guess); I'd get a little jealous seeing all the people saying thank you on this channel, feeling "should I be doing more to get as enthusiastic and happy as them?"; and just generally anxious for not having enough time to be with my family, do my full-time job (not for long), work on the next adventure, and also read and watch all the curated material.

I'm not gonna lie, I still have those negative (complementary opposing) feelings... at least sometimes :slightly_smiling_face:.

:mostly_sunny:But then I realized people and groups don't (necessarily) care about my expectations. I really understood and appreciated the "group with loosely shared interests" description of the fellows. I started to find new language to express my ideas, to communicate better, and to just appreciate those conflicting feelings, because they moved me to action. I found myself having more conversations and asking better questions (initially just to myself). And finally, thanks to a conversation with @Sarah Hamburg, who wisely said "KERNEL is a marathon, not a sprint" (Thanks for that, Sarah!), I started to think more long-term.

:kernel-love: Thank you for igniting this in me. From this inner turmoil, love-hate relationship, that KERNEL has been, a new (hopefully better) Guillermo emerges.
I look forward to more adventures together and continue to obsessively check this slack in the future (I struggle to control my FOMO). Thanks @Sarah Hamburg @Holly Grimm @Saskia Westhof @Aimara Garcia Cabezas @Greg Becker @Ray Di Felice @snax y-not @Tim Courtney for amazing conversations.

Finally, the whole theme of KERNEL reminded me of <https://sites.evergreen.edu/politicalshakespeares/wp-content/uploads/sites/226/2015/12/Borges-Tl%C3%B6n-Uqbar-Orbius-Tertius.pdf|"Tlon, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius">, by my favorite author Jorge Luis Borges. Check it out.
> "Then English and French and mere Spanish will disappear from the globe. The world will be Tlon."

First of all thank you very much to the kernel team who decided to make me a part of KB4. Thank you very much @Sarah Hamburg for introducing me to Opscientia and encouraging me to apply for open web fellowship after knowing about the project I wanted to build. And a very huge thanks to @Shady El Damaty without whom I would have never got the confidence and support that I have in the project today. Thanks for believing in me and for giving me the opportunity to be a part of open web fellowship and Opscientia.

Wow just floored by all the incredible ideas from @Sarah Hamburg during our 1 on 1. Hard to believe a single person can have such wisdom across so many fields of study (neuroscience, arts, funding, banking... the list goes on!). Really excited to be collaborating with you further, and so grateful both for the chance to meet you and for you being so open and inviting with your creative projects as well. Keep your eyes peeled for Sarah's posts, you don't wanna sleep on these incredible projects  :eyes:
Also, had a great first junto on decentralized media hosted by @Alex Yao with @Diana Chen, @Sarah Hamburg and more!
@Rahul // r-nk.xyz Love this, appreciate the share. Good work on this @Mike Elias. Check this out @Sarah Hamburg and @Shady El Damaty <https://docs.ideamarket.io/>

U01JT9P8NMS.message:
I couldn’t let this experience end without sending some love to the KB4 community. Kernel has been an amazing journey and I think the best part is that it feels like the start of an even richer adventure. I’ve had some incredible conversations over the past 8 weeks, but wanted to say a special thanks to a few people:
• @Jasmine Wang for an intellectual brunch that opened up a number of new paths for me :sailboat: 
• @Michael Zargham for helping me sift through the noise and zero in on where I want to focus :dart: 
• @cryptowanderer for (per usual) providing a level-headed perspective on this world :male_mage: 
• @snax y-not for riffing on food, fun, and the future of franchises :pizza: 
• @Michael Keating for comparing notes in the early days and spearheading the tokenomics guild :scales: 
• my ~girlfriend~ fiance for providing endless support and agreeing to marry me back in week 3 :ring: 
I’m gutted to miss the final session today (will be traveling :disappointed:), but I take solace in the fact that I’ll see you all out in the garden very soon :slightly_smiling_face:

@Magenta Ceiba @Holly Grimm Happy to jam on the models mentioned in these <https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Two-Row-Wampum-Metagov-Grant--BFAC9F3F8xEcJ7eyrglk041FAQ-a13UqrvYn6gTr2YIHqLNq|grant drafts> if you guys are interested :ocean::ocean::ocean: :slightly_smiling_face: Also would just love your eyes on what we are up to in our first prototype. Will include latest meeting with Eglash & Mayan midwife rep ASAP it was amazing to see :fire: Not to forget the great @Joshua Tan & @Michael Zargham

U02FUQF7USV.message: Before starting KERNEL, I knew I wanted to build a dApp but had no idea what to build, how to build and who to build it with. Now at the end of KERNEL, not only I learnt so much about Web3, I went on an adventure with a wonderful team and made a beautiful prototype and working on a potentially world-changing idea. Thank you @Nate Jacobs and @Martin Etzrodt  and @Eddy Schauman-Haigh @Bolo Michelin @Amir Jabarivasal , also many others who have supported us along the way, particularly  @Brent Annells  and @Anuj Kodam for your generous connection and advice, and the wonderfully eloquent , generous and wise @cryptowanderer.  Now KB4 is ending but my web3 journey has just started. Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> for bringing in such wonderful people and creating this high trust space for magic to happen. :pray::kernel-love::shamrock::rainbow::heart::pray:

This whole experience has been so great, I came in looking for one thing and I have received so much more value than I could have ever expected.

So much gratitude for the opportunity to share a story in last weeks kernel junto. I cried, again. It's an amazing empowering feeling to have a context within which to tell some small but deeply meaningful part of my lifestory without feeling openly critisied or judged. @Tommy Nienchi Chen for an opening to share my 'freedom of choice' within a direct context:seedling: @Anuj Kodam your support meant the world to me thank you, thank you for seeing courage where so many others would see failure/stubborness/stupidity :heart: @cryptowanderer for sharing your story which in stark contrast to my freedom, helps as always build perspective :peace_symbol: And ghandi's note "my life is my message" - I can highly recommend the autobiography (read after the fact):book: And to my fourth quiet listener, sorry I forget :wave: you guys have no idea how transformative it is to share some truths outside of my family and friends. Love light & blessing to you each XXOO
Shout out to @Tommy Nienchi Chen for introducing me to the Kernel and encouraging me to apply!

I’m excited for @Bianca Aguilar @Vince Trost @Andrew C @Elmo Chong - can’t wait to see what you all do in your next iteration!

I thought I'd drop a line here as I'm just jumping back into Kernel after quite a time away.  My web3 journey didn't start with Kernel but it did start with Gitcoin back in early 2019 after I heard a podcast with @Kevin Owocki that was my first step down the rabbit hole.  After hacking away on bounties for more than year (quite a few for Gitcoin Core), I saw the first mentions of the Kernel program and applied.  After a fruitful interview with @Vivek Singh and @Sachin Mittal, I waited a few weeks and wondered if I'd ever hear back.  I feel like the poster child for imposter syndrome in the web3 world and I was more than surprised when I got the email inviting me to join the Kernel Genesis Block.  The rest, as they say, is history.  I'm thankful for having been included in this community of builders and thinkers and also for the whole Gitcoin community of growing open source .  I'm definitely not the deepest thinker here or the best coder (not by a country mile), but it was this community that really helped me find my footing to go from where I was (someone who felt purposeless and unfruitful in my then vocation) to where I am now (an active, engaged dev working on Ethereum infrastructure who wakes up every day excited to do what I've been called to do and to see the world get turned upside down by what we're building).  So thank you @Kevin Owocki for building Gitcoin, @Vivek Singh, @Sachin Mittal,  and@cryptowanderer for Kernel, and to others along the way who have given me opportunities to build cool stuff and to be a part of web3 like @Rob Secord and @Ben Lakoff from Charged Particles, @Mike Elias from Idea Market, various folks from the Status/Nimbus team, @Shresth Agrawal, @Jose Aguinaga...etc.

it all starts with a :seedling:

thank you @Rev Miller @Ben Lakoff @Vivek Singh @Sachin Mittal @johnx25bd @cryptowanderer @Angela Gilhotra :kernel-love:

We had an absolutely fantastic "Climate Impact Group" kickoff chat on Monday! The intention was just get together, geek out on all things decarbonising web 3 & leveraging things like DeFi to accelerate the vision of a planet positive, carbon negative future for all including jamming on things like the devastation faced by our oceans in example.

If you missed it, don't worry, you can find the recording in <#C01UUEDM934|feed-session-recordings> but essentially we spent a lot of time on intros & getting to know each other better which was lovely, had some climate convo led by @Raphael Haupt & some others, deciding that essentially we would co-ord in <#C01KHR1M0LA|jam-climate> & find a time that suited all of us as best as possible to make the event a reoccurring thing.

Thanks to all the fantastic people & minds that attended @Abe Uccello @Ben Lakoff @Holly Grimm @Raphael Haupt @Kevin Davis @Laurens De Poorter @Robin Roy Thomas.  Sorry to the people I've missed, had some difficulty finding your Slack @. Please DM me so can add you to the thread if you see this! :slightly_smiling_face:

#CLIMATEGANG

Hey all, time flew, and now with things calming down a bit, I want to express my gratitude towards those that made the past few months so special, It was a big wave for me and ethblockart, and without the help of mentors, fellows, and the kernel team, I wouldn't have been able to stay atop the surfboard!

For starters, I wanna express my gratitude towards many of the mentors, present and supportive in genuinely important ways throughout this adventure: Defi_Dad, @Thomas Klocanas, @Linda Xie, @Shawn Cheng @Ben Lakoff, @Dave Rodman, @Harsh Rajat and @Scott Moore. You folks are amazing and your help instrumental.

Other fellows, always positive, helpful and inspiring in the best way possible even while busy with their own adventures, like @Simon Fremaux, @Carter Carlson and the best-practices gang, @Holly Grimm, and the DADA team, even if we didn't interact much directly, know you've been an inspiration for many years!

And how can we not be grateful for the Kernel team, receiving us all with open arms and unparalleled patience and kindness, @Sachin Mittal, @Vivek Singh and others, one-of-a-kind human beings which I'm honoured to have met and spend time with. :pray:

Lastly, I can't write this without a special note to @cryptowanderer, embracing the project mission from the start, contributing in ways I couldn't have expected, making what the project is today a reality, you're amazing, thank you again.

One can say riding a market like we're experiencing today as a solo builder with a somewhat market-fit product can feel like choosing Jaws, Maui as a go-to surf spot while still learning to surf, sure some can pull off the once-in-a-lifetime herculean task of achieving so alone...But what enables surfers to, time and time again, execute this impressive feat, a humbling celebration of our ability to face head-first the scariest challenges posed by nature, are exactly other humans, community, supporters often not celebrated, from the tow-in jet sky riders, the lifeguards bringing you oxygen, to the chanting crowd by the coast and even the sharks keeping you alert.

Back to the point, what is being done here at Kernel is unique, every step planned with a level of care hard to find elsewhere, and it is also upon us all to keep this flame awake and the kernel culture principled, I hope to in the future be able to help others the same way I was helped here, for that is what makes the world go round.

For now, thank you Kernel, for all, and happy spring! :seedling:

Deep gratitude from BFLO team for your insights and support 

Super grateful to our team @Akanksha Bhattachan @acolytec3 @Jared Childers @Gary Fitts @Miranda Baghashvili, the other amazing fellows who contributed insight  @Milensu Kapaipi @Angela Gilhotra @Eman Herawy @Ben Lakoff @Simona Pop @johnx25bd @Harsh Rajat @Alex Thomas @Mark Muskardin
And for the Kernel creators whose hearts and minds are full of brilliant goodness @Sachin Mittal @Vivek Singh @cryptowanderer 
And the mentors for taking time @Hudson Jameson @Mark B @ken 

It’s a wonderful experience I am so glad I was able to be a part of

(I cry when I laugh when I'm sad mad anything moving really) so grateful right now for You! And kernel for this feeling  - when you add a piece to a puzzle and the bigger picture becomes suddenly more clear - Thank you so much for this Hope and direction on a journey that's been (and expect will be) a lifetime in the making. <https://youtu.be/uN4g0Sr3jhs> so many half-formed questions, will watch again #panvalafiresidesforever #changetheincentiveschangetheoutcome
Thanks @Niran Babalola, @cryptowanderer, @Vivek Singh, @Angela Gilhotra and everyone in the chat for an inspiring fireside chat today :pray:

U01JFN7B5T8.message: Thank you @Dave Rodman for the legal advisement yesterday during Office Hours. Always important to hear attorneys’ objective opinion to make the most informed decision as a founder.

Hey all, time flew, and now with things calming down a bit, I want to express my gratitude towards those that made the past few months so special, It was a big wave for me and ethblockart, and without the help of mentors, fellows, and the kernel team, I wouldn't have been able to stay atop the surfboard!

For starters, I wanna express my gratitude towards many of the mentors, present and supportive in genuinely important ways throughout this adventure: Defi_Dad, @Thomas Klocanas, @Linda Xie, @Shawn Cheng @Ben Lakoff, @Dave Rodman, @Harsh Rajat and @Scott Moore. You folks are amazing and your help instrumental.

Other fellows, always positive, helpful and inspiring in the best way possible even while busy with their own adventures, like @Simon Fremaux, @Carter Carlson and the best-practices gang, @Holly Grimm, and the DADA team, even if we didn't interact much directly, know you've been an inspiration for many years!

And how can we not be grateful for the Kernel team, receiving us all with open arms and unparalleled patience and kindness, @Sachin Mittal, @Vivek Singh and others, one-of-a-kind human beings which I'm honoured to have met and spend time with. :pray:

Lastly, I can't write this without a special note to @cryptowanderer, embracing the project mission from the start, contributing in ways I couldn't have expected, making what the project is today a reality, you're amazing, thank you again.

One can say riding a market like we're experiencing today as a solo builder with a somewhat market-fit product can feel like choosing Jaws, Maui as a go-to surf spot while still learning to surf, sure some can pull off the once-in-a-lifetime herculean task of achieving so alone...But what enables surfers to, time and time again, execute this impressive feat, a humbling celebration of our ability to face head-first the scariest challenges posed by nature, are exactly other humans, community, supporters often not celebrated, from the tow-in jet sky riders, the lifeguards bringing you oxygen, to the chanting crowd by the coast and even the sharks keeping you alert.

Back to the point, what is being done here at Kernel is unique, every step planned with a level of care hard to find elsewhere, and it is also upon us all to keep this flame awake and the kernel culture principled, I hope to in the future be able to help others the same way I was helped here, for that is what makes the world go round.

For now, thank you Kernel, for all, and happy spring! :seedling:

U02FNC8G4TW.message: Really thankful to @Cynthia Alexander for introducing Kernel to us. This community of builders, artists, investors, dreamers, gamers, and everyone in between is so inspiring and I am so grateful to be a part of the web3 world we are creating. :pray: :kernel-love:
